lines.line_text: The moon had joined the splendid height,
When William waked to weep the night,

stanzas.stanza_text:
The moon had joined the splendid height,
The world retired to rest,
When William waked to weep the night,
For cares disturbed his breast.

lines.line_text: Eliza's loss he mourned in vain,
For death her eyes had closed,
Silenced that tongue which soothed his pain,

stanzas.stanza_text:
Eliza's loss he mourned in vain,
For death her eyes had closed,
Silenced that tongue which soothed his pain,
And every grief composed.

lines.line_text: Oh! baneful death he still would say,
My peace had never known decay,

stanzas.stanza_text:
Oh! baneful death he still would say,
Why did'st thou torture me?
My peace had never known decay,
Fell tyrant, but for thee.

lines.line_text: My blest Eliza! still he cries,
When lo! before his wandering eyes,

stanzas.stanza_text:
My blest Eliza! still he cries,
Thou hast thy forfeit paid;
When lo! before his wandering eyes,
Appeared the conscious shade.

lines.line_text: The smile of peace she wore;

stanzas.stanza_text:
Celestial charms adorned her face,
The smile of peace she wore;
And whispered with angelic grace,
"My William mourn no more.

lines.line_text: "Nay, start not love! dispel all fear,
"I come to stop the gushing tear,

stanzas.stanza_text:
"Nay, start not love! dispel all fear,
" The messenger of peace,
"I come to stop the gushing tear,
" And bid thy mourning cease.

lines.line_text: "Or did'st thou think the fleeting breath,

stanzas.stanza_text:
"Did'st thou suppose relentless death,
" Wou'd not his claim assert?
"Or did'st thou think the fleeting breath,
" Wou'd never leave the heart?

lines.line_text: "Oh! cease to weep, to mourn forbear,

stanzas.stanza_text:
"Oh! cease to weep, to mourn forbear,
" From sorrow I am free,
"And smile at every earthly care,
" Except the care of thee.

"The gentle passion which we knew.
" That cheers the guiltless mind,
"Exalted still I feel for you,
" In purity refined.

lines.line_text: "In those bright realms remote from woe,

stanzas.stanza_text:
"In those bright realms remote from woe,
" Where suns eternal shine,
"Imperfect bliss I only know,
" While you for me repine.

lines.line_text: "I did not take a long adieu,
" Thou wilt not long feel pain,
"Thy friends must mourn, must weep for you,

stanzas.stanza_text:
"I did not take a long adieu,
" Thou wilt not long feel pain,
"Thy friends must mourn, must weep for you,
" And we shall meet again.

lines.line_text: "O'er all thy ways I kindly wait,
"I'll guide thee in this erring state,

stanzas.stanza_text:
"O'er all thy ways I kindly wait,
" I ward each threat'ning ill;
"I'll guide thee in this erring state,
" Thy guardian angel still.

lines.line_text: "And when thy soul is gently fled,
" To those fine realms of day,

stanzas.stanza_text:
"And when thy soul is gently fled,
" To those fine realms of day,
"Some guardian spirit of the dead,
" Shall watch thy sleeping clay.

"Thou'st not forgot the awful hour,
" When death assailed my heart,
"When sternly he denied the power,
" My wishes to impart.

lines.line_text: "Then hear me now, protect our race,
"With love like this my memory grace,

stanzas.stanza_text:
"Then hear me now, protect our race,
" 'Tis thine to guide their youth;
"With love like this my memory grace,
" Let this display thy truth.

lines.line_text: "But see ‚Äî the gates of light unclose,

stanzas.stanza_text:
"But see ‚Äî the gates of light unclose,
" My love, a last adieu,
"I go to undisturbed repose,
" There wait to welcome you.
